# newDocument

**Instance Property**

An action in the environment that presents a new document.

## Declaration

```swift
var newDocument: NewDocumentAction { get }
```

## Discussion

Use the `newDocument` environment value to get the instance of the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/NewDocumentAction] structure for a given [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Environment]. Then call the instance to present a new document. You call the instance directly because it defines a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/NewDocumentAction/callAsFunction(_:)] method that Swift calls when you call the instance.

For example, you can define a button that creates a new document from the selected text:

```swift
struct NewDocumentFromSelection: View {
    @FocusedBinding(\.selectedText) private var selectedText: String?
    @Environment(\.newDocument) private var newDocument

    var body: some View {
        Button("New Document With Selection") {
            newDocument(TextDocument(text: selectedText))
        }
        .disabled(selectedText?.isEmpty != false)
    }
}
```

The above example assumes that you define a `TextDocument` that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/FileDocument] or [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/ReferenceFileDocument] protocol, and a [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/DocumentGroup] that handles the associated file type.

## Opening a document programmatically

- **NewDocumentAction**: An action that presents a new document.
- **openDocument**: An action in the environment that presents an existing document.
- **OpenDocumentAction**: An action that presents an existing document.
